title: ‘Touched, hugged': AI staffer groped South Korean woman during frisking at B'luru airport; arrested

The accused, lacking the authority to conduct proper security checks, reportedly inappropriately touched her and embraced her, all under the pretense of 'manual frisking' in a secluded area near the restrooms.

title: 'Dhurandhar' slows down ahead of 'Border 2' release

Despite this, the film has maintained strong collections, reaching an impressive Rs 829.4 crore net. Facing competition, its box office journey continues as it eyes further milestones.

title: Mid-air medical emergency: Passenger collapses on IndiGo flight; dies after landing at Nagpur
description: A 72-year-old passenger on an Indigo flight from Ghaziabad to Chennai tragically passed away mid-air. The aircraft made an emergency landing in Nagpur where medical teams were prepared. Despite efforts, including CPR administered by a doctor on board, the man was declared brought dead at a local hospital. He reportedly had a history of heart ailment.

description: The ICC has rejected Bangladesh's plea to shift T20 World Cup matches from India to Sri Lanka, citing no credible security threats. Fourteen of sixteen board members voted against the relocation, emphasizing the need to maintain event integrity. Bangladesh has been given an extended deadline to confirm participation.

Sharma explains that balancing the team often required tough calls. He emphasizes open communication and building trust within the squad. Sharma expresses confidence in the current Indian team's stability and understanding.

title: Activist in jail for 7 years sans trial, SC steps in to hasten proceedings
description: The Supreme Court will order an expedited hearing for lawyer-activist Surendra Gadling in the 2016 Surajgarh arson case, acknowledging his seven-year incarceration without trial. The court will also address the appointment of a judge to the special court and the transfer of evidence from the NIA court.

title: SC to set up expert panel on Aravalis, tells states to stop illegal mining 'at all costs'
description: The Supreme Court has ordered Delhi, Haryana, and Rajasthan to halt illegal mining in the Aravali hills, citing irreversible ecological damage.  A new expert body will be formed to conduct a scientific examination of the ranges to ensure their structural and ecological integrity, with states tasked to stop all illicit mining until then.

title: 5 traffic offences in a year could bar you from driving
description: Habitual traffic offenders face a new penalty as the road transport ministry has amended rules to disqualify driving licenses for five or more offenses in a year. This provision, effective January 1, aims to curb errant drivers, though experts raise concerns about enforcement and potential challenges to recorded offenses.

title: 65 student suicides at IITs in 5 yrs, alumni group calls for accountability

description: Denver Broncos quarterback Bo Nix suffered a fractured ankle in the AFC Divisional Round, ruling him out for the Conference Championship. Despite a viral satire rumor, the team confirmed Nix will undergo surgery and begin rehabilitation, with backup Jarrett Stidham set to start. Nix is expected to make a full recovery for the 2026 season.

Are artery plaque and tooth plaque the same? Cardiologist and dentist explain the link
description: Two types of plaque, tooth and artery, share a connection. Tooth plaque, a bacterial film on teeth, can lead to gum disease. Artery plaque, made of cholesterol and fat, builds up in blood vessels. Both are linked by inflammation and bacteria. Good oral hygiene reduces inflammation, benefiting both teeth and heart health. This connection highlights the body's interconnected systems.

'What I saw in Goa was something I could have never imagined'
description: The author, a travel writer, finds Goa's charm not in its crowded beaches but in its quiet hinterlands and unexpected encounters with local art.  A past unpleasant tourist experience led to a preference for offbeat exploration, revealing the state's lush monsoon beauty and serene village life, far from the typical tourist trail.

description: During the World Economic Forum, President Trump continued to conflate Iceland and Greenland, suggesting NATO members' affection for him waned after he discussed Iceland. He described his request for Greenland as a "piece of ice" vital for global peace, contrasting it with NATO's decades of benefits.

description: Anthony Lynn has emerged as an early candidate to replace Sean McDermott as the Bills’ head coach, according to ESPN’s Adam Schefter. A former Bills assistant and ex-Chargers head coach, Lynn brings familiarity with the organization and years of NFL experience. Buffalo leadership is expected to address his reported link to the job during an upcoming press conference.

description: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor lauded new Indian cricket coach Gautam Gambhir in Nagpur, calling his role immensely challenging. Tharoor praised Gambhir's composure amidst constant public scrutiny and his quiet determination. He wished the coach success as India embarks on a crucial white-ball schedule, including preparations for the 2026 T20 World Cup.

While emphasizing sport's separation from politics, she acknowledged the situation could evolve. The remarks follow US President Trump's comments on Greenland, raising concerns among European allies.

Gauri, a mother of one, is now professionally involved with his production house, further intertwining their lives.

description: The ICC has rejected Bangladesh's request to shift T20 World Cup matches from India, threatening to replace them if they refuse to travel. This decision follows a dispute over pacer Mustafizur Rahman's IPL removal and Bangladesh's subsequent ban on IPL broadcasts. Scotland is poised to replace Bangladesh if they maintain their stance.

K'taka Guv vs Sidda govt: Gehlot refuses to address joint session; what triggered row
description: Karnataka governor Thaawarchand Gehlot has refused to deliver the customary address to the legislature, adding to a recent trend of gubernatorial disputes. This follows similar incidents in Kerala and Tamil Nadu, where governors clashed with state governments over speech content and assembly proceedings. The Karnataka government is set to meet the governor to understand his reasons.

Daryl dethrones Kohli to claim No.1 ODI ranking; Rohit slips to fourth
description: Daryl Mitchell has ascended to the top of the men's ODI batting rankings, surpassing Virat Kohli after a stellar series against India. Mitchell's consecutive centuries powered New Zealand's victory and earned him the No. 1 spot with 845 rating points. Ibrahim Zadran also climbed to third, while Glenn Phillips reached 20th.

title: Donald Trump flags China, Russia threat in Greenland — how real is the danger?
Since 2021, rule by rule: How the Taliban have erased women from public life
description: Since the Taliban's return in August 2021, Afghan women's basic freedoms have been systematically curtailed, transforming them into privileges. Girls are barred from secondary education and universities, most jobs are off-limits, and public spaces are restricted, severely shrinking women's public existence amid economic collapse.

title: 'ChatGPT is dying': Legendary investor says $500bn company faces collapse— read his 600-word note
description: Veteran investor George Noble warns OpenAI is "falling apart" despite its $500 billion valuation. He cites internal "Code Red" alerts, declining ChatGPT traffic, massive quarterly losses of $12 billion, and unsustainable costs for tools like Sora. Key departures and Elon Musk's lawsuit further highlight significant internal turmoil and financial strain.

title: Candace Owens pushes new theory blaming Mikey McCoy’s wife in TPUSA drama
description: Candace Owens shared a conspiracy theory claiming Elizabeth McCoy may be giving Erika Kirk bad advice at Turning Point USA. She compared the situation to Mean Girls and said the mistakes looked planned. Owens also criticized TPUSA for sending a legal letter to YouTuber Zack Gregorio, saying the move would only backfire.

title: Who is Cece? Twitch streamer at center of Marvel Rivals Creator Cup controversy
description: Twitch streamer Cecee faced online backlash after a heated incident during a Marvel Rivals tournament.  She insulted a teammate during a live match.  Cecee later apologized, admitting her mistakes as team captain.  She stated she reacted emotionally and failed to de-escalate the situation.  The streamer promised to improve her leadership skills.
